[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Claims and Repair Management System (CRMS) defines requirements for compliance, usability, security, and performance in handling claims and repair facility operations.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: CRMS provides a secure platform for claims processing and repair facility management, ensuring corporate and regulatory compliance.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: CRMS integrates with the ChoiceParts system and repair facility databases.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: CRMS supports a professional UI compliant with corporate design guidelines.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: CRMS is compatible with desktops in office and repair shop environments.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: CRMS uses RESTful APIs for search operations and transaction processing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: CRMS ensures secure data exchange using HTTPS/TLS 1.3.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: CRMS is optimized for high-volume insurance transactions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: CRMS maintains generally available uptime per corporate schedules.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: CRMS supports accessibility and remote usage by adjusters.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: CRMS links to compliance, insurance, and claims databases.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: CRMS facilitates recycled parts searches, preferred repair facility selection, and audit reporting.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: CRMS is designed for adjusters and collision estimators handling claims and repairs.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: CRMS requires stable corporate network access and authentication.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: CRMS depends on the ChoiceParts system and repair facility database.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Recycled Parts: Salvaged vehicle parts for repairs.
Audit Report: Evaluation of recycled parts usage.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall interface with the ChoiceParts system for daily parts data retrieval.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall connect to the repair facility rating database to store and retrieve facility scores.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow adjusters to search for preferred repair facilities using vehicle data (REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall enable collision estimators to search for recycled parts based on vehicle parts and supplier lists (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall generate an audit report detailing recycled parts availability and usage.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall comply with corporate UI and color scheme standards.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall provide in-app help for at least 90% of functionalities.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall return recycled parts search results within a brief moment under normal conditions.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall complete repair facility searches within 8 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall retain search results for recycled parts and repair facilities for reference.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with corporate architecture guidelines.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall operate on existing corporate hardware.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with Sarbanes-Oxley and insurance regulations.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall maintain generally available uptime, following corporate availability guidelines.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests search accuracy, audit reports, UI compliance, and security enforcement.
